title: Issues with google RMA
content:
I had a google pixel 4 which I loved like a baby. I have been a pixel user from the days of Nexus 4. My pixel 4 all of a sudden couldn't charge. Google recommended I take it to their contracted repair shop which they fixed for free. 

A few months later the phone couldn't charge again, couldn't read simcards or play through loud speaker. I took it back to the shop where it was fixed before but the tech recommended google to do an RMA since it was beyond repair.

I open up a case with google, went through the basics and finally said they would send me a replacement after sending them my faulty device.

I was supposedly sent instructions through email on how to return the phone. I have never seen any email with such instructions yet google say they processed the return. I have checked my spam, trash and every folder I could think of but nothing.

Everytime I have reached out to google, they have  taken me through the same cycle of my case was escalated but nothing progresses on my end. I got lucky one time and got on a call with google. A lady did a screen sharing on my loaner pixel 3a and confirmed that indeed I didn't have the email she was expecting to see in my inbox.

The experience has been really terrible and at this point, I have given up on Google pixels. I feel like google is not doing enough to support it's customers like Apple does. 

HAS ANYONE GONE THROUGH A SIMILAR RMA PROCESS?

I am disappointed and frustrated.
